ClientInterfaces

Class MainApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • ClientInterfaces.MainApplication

  • public class MainApplication
extends java.lang.Object
    KMIP v 2.0 Java Library/API is extensible, easily upgradable (to integrate features of future KMIP versions), and open source. An object of this class needs to be created in order to access the services provided by this library.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Vedika Ghei, Soha Parasnis, Tanisha Rathi, Vidushi Mishra

      This method allows the user to create a key, of the specified length, type and cryptographic algorithm, on the key management server.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> createKeyPair(java.lang.String algorithm, int length, java.lang.String type, java.lang.String privateKeyNameValue, java.lang.String publicKeyNameValue)
      This method allows the user to create a key pair (a public and a private key), of the specified length, type and cryptographic algorithm, on the key management server.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> destroykey(java.lang.String uniqueIdentifier)
      This method allows the user to destroy the key that already exists on the key management server, using its Unique Identifier.

      Sets the IP and Port of the key management server, as specified by user, for a session and returns the object of type Connection.

      This method allows the user to get the key format type and key material of a particular key that already exists on the key management server, using its Unique Identifier.

    • Method Detail

      • getConnection

        public Connection getConnection(java.lang.String IP,
                                int Port)
                         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Sets the IP and Port of the key management server, as specified by user, for a session and returns the object of type Connection.
        Parameters:
        IP - IP Address of the key management server
        Port - port number where the key management server listens
        Returns:
        object of type Connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        Connection

      • setKeyStore

        public void setKeyStore(java.lang.String TrustStorePath,
                        java.lang.String TrustStoreType,
                        java.lang.String TrustStorePassword)
        Sets the key store and trust store path, type (for eg. JCEKS), and the password.
        Parameters:
        TrustStorePath - a path that specifies where the key store and trust store is located
        TrustStoreType - the type of the key store and trust store used
        TrustStorePassword - the key store and trust store password

      • createKey

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> createKey(java.lang.String algorithm,
                                                  int length,
                                                  java.lang.String type)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        This method allows the user to create a key, of the specified length, type and cryptographic algorithm, on the key management server.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - Cryptographic Algorithm (for eg. AES)
        length - length of the key in bits (for eg. 128)
        type - type of key (input syntax example: SymmetricKey)
        Returns:
        List<String>the Unique Identifier of the key, after its creation on the key management server
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Exception

      • createKeyPair

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> createKeyPair(java.lang.String algorithm,
                                                      int length,
                                                      java.lang.String type,
                                                      java.lang.String privateKeyNameValue,
                                                      java.lang.String publicKeyNameValue)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        This method allows the user to create a key pair (a public and a private key), of the specified length, type and cryptographic algorithm, on the key management server.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - Cryptographic Algorithm (for eg. RSA)
        length - length of the key in bits (for eg. 1024)
        type - type of key (input syntax example: AsymmetricKey)
        privateKeyNameValue - a unique, meaningful name assigned to the private key
        publicKeyNameValue - a unique, meaningful name assigned to the public key
        Returns:
        List<String>the Unique Identifiers of both the keys, public and private
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getKey

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getKey(java.lang.String uniqueIdentifier)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This method allows the user to get the key format type and key material of a particular key that already exists on the key management server, using its Unique Identifier.
        Parameters:
        uniqueIdentifier - UniqueIdentifier of a key that already exists on the key management server
        Returns:
        List<String> unique identifier, key format type, key material
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Exception

      • destroykey

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> destroykey(java.lang.String uniqueIdentifier)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        This method allows the user to destroy the key that already exists on the key management server, using its Unique Identifier. Once a key is destroyed, the user can see it using LocateKey, but cannot get it using GetKey
        Parameters:
        uniqueIdentifier - UniqueIdentifier of a key that already exists on the key management server
        Returns:
        List<String> unique identifier of the destroyed key
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Exception

      • locateKey

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> locateKey(java.lang.String objectType)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        This method allows the user to locate a key on the key management server, using its object type. The user can access the UniqueIdentifier of a key, even after it is destroyed.
        Parameters:
        objectType - the object type of the key (for eg. "SymmetricKey", "PublicKey", "PrivateKey").
        Returns:
        List<String> all the unique identifiers of the existing keys of the object type specified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Exception

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This is the main method in the entire library API.
        Parameters:
        args -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
